abstract_summ: An exponential decay model applied to the cumulated and weighted average daily growth rate appears to be useful in estimating the number of cases and peak of the COVID-19 outbreak in Italy and the model was more reliable in the exponential growth phase.We specified a simple joint model on data from 20 countries with number of confirmed COVID-19 infections and number of COVID-19 deaths.On the base of logic discrete equations system mathematical modeling of COVID-19 epidemic spread was carried out in the world and in the countries with the largest number of infected people such as the USA, Brasil, Russia and India in the first half of 2020.It was shown that for the countries with strong restrictive measures the spread of COVID-19 fit on a single wave with small capacity as for a number of countries with violation of restrictive measures the spread of the epidemic fit on a waves superposition.To assess the impact of confinement (March 17th till May 11th) and deconfinement, we develop a novel rate model to monitor and predict the spread of the epidemic and its impact on the health care system.
title_summ: A fundamental model and predictions for the spread of the COVID-19 epidemicMonitoring and predicting SARS-CoV-2 epidemic in France after deconfinement using a multiscale age-stratified rate modelRelations of parameters for describing the epidemic of COVID―19 by the Kermack―McKendrick modelA pragmatic model to forecast the COVID-19 epidemic in different countries and allowing for daily updatesEstimating the size of the COVID-19 outbreak in Italy: Application of an exponential decay model to the weighted and cumulative average daily growth rateSuperposition of waves for modeling COVID-19 epidemic in the world and in the countries with the maximum number of infected people in the first half of 2020A model for the spread of an epidemic from local to global: A case study of COVID-19 in IndiaModelling the Extremes of Seasonal Viruses and Hospital Congestion: The Example of Flu in a Swiss HospitalExtension of a SIR model for modelling the propagation of Covid-19 in several countries.
title_abstract_phrases: An exponential decay model applied to the cumulated and weighted average daily growth rate appears to be useful in estimating the number of cases and peak of the COVID-19 outbreak in Italy and the model was more reliable in the exponential growth phase.Superposition of waves for modeling COVID-19 epidemic in the world and in the countries with the maximum number of infected people in the first half of 2020On the base of logic discrete equations system mathematical modeling of COVID-19 epidemic spread was carried out in the world and in the countries with the largest number of infected people such as the USA, Brasil, Russia and India in the first half of 2020.We specified a simple joint model on data from 20 countries with number of confirmed COVID-19 infections and number of COVID-19 deaths.A fundamental model and predictions for the spread of the COVID-19 epidemicThe spread of the novel coronavirus is characterized by two phases: (I) a natural exponential growth phase that occurs in the absence of intervention and (II) a regulated growth phase that is affected by enforcing social distancing and isolation.It was shown that for the countries with strong restrictive measures the spread of COVID-19 fit on a single wave with small capacity as for a number of countries with violation of restrictive measures the spread of the epidemic fit on a waves superposition.
